definition: dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
(onom.) sound of cawing/sound of infant learning to talk/variant of 呀[ya1]
dumb/mute/hoarse/husky/unexploded (of artillery shell etc)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
words/speech/to say/to talk

sentences.english: At the end of the son’s reply the father was speechless.
sentences.chinese: 聽完兒子的話，父親啞口無言。

sentences.english: The blessing of the Lord is upon the head of the just: but iniquity covereth the mouth of the wicked.
sentences.chinese: 上主的祝福在義人頭上，災禍卻使惡人啞口無言。

sentences.english: I couldn't understand why Mana Ina would not answer my parents when they asked her questions.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道爲什麼父母問曼娜艾娜問題時她卻啞口無言。

sentences.english: She extinguished him with a single word.
sentences.chinese: 她一句話就說得他啞口無言。

sentences.english: A series of ironclad facts put him to silence.
sentences.chinese: 一系列鐵的事實駁得他啞口無言。

sentences.english: If he doesn't call, he's probably still tongue-tied from being in your presence.
sentences.chinese: 如果他不請，他大概仍啞口無言被你的存在。

sentences.english: Robert was shocked almost to dumbness.
sentences.chinese: 羅伯特被驚得啞口無言。

sentences.english: She squelched them with biting sarcasm.
sentences.chinese: 她用尖刻的挖苦話使人啞口無言。

sentences.english: Louis and I were speechless, paralyzed.
sentences.chinese: 路易斯和我都啞口無言，呆住了。

sentences.english: We gaze at each other as dumb animals gaze at human beings.
sentences.chinese: 我們啞口無言，像愚笨的動物癡望人類一樣面面相覷。

sentences.english: In the face of such irrefutable FACTS, he was struck dumb.
sentences.chinese: 在這樣確鑿的事實面前，他驚得啞口無言。

sentences.english: Me for my dumb thoughts, speaking in effect.
sentences.chinese: 敬我，爲我的啞口無言的真誠。

sentences.english: I want to argue but be rendered speechless, because I believe.
sentences.chinese: 我欲爭辨卻又啞口無言，因爲我相信鬼話。

sentences.english: DUMB】The class remained dumb when the teacher asked a difficult question.
sentences.chinese: 當老師問一難題時，全班啞口無言。
他的辯才使得我們啞口無言。

sentences.english: We were struck dumb with horror and grief.
sentences.chinese: 驚恐和憂傷使我們啞口無言。

definition: lit. doesn't hurt, doesn't tickle (idiom); sth is wrong, but not quite sure what/fig. not getting to any matter of substance/scratching the surface/superficial/perfunctory
lit. the soul flies away and scatters (idiom)/fig. to be frightened stiff/spooked out of one's mind/terror-stricken
the content of a conversation/words/remarks
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
crafty plots and machinations (idiom)
righteous indignation fills one's breast (idiom); to feel indignant at injustice
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
ashamed and unable to show one's face
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to fight back/to return fire/to counterattack
red in the face/extremely angry
to keep silent
